titleStmt.title: The tvvo famous pitcht battels of Lypsich, and Lutzen wherein the ever-renowned Prince Gustavus the Great lived and died a conquerour: with an elegie upon his untimely death, composed in heroick verse by John Russell, Master of Arts, of Magdalene Coll. in Cambridge.
titleStmt.author: Russell, John, d. 1688.

titleStmt.title: The tvvo famous pitcht battels of Lypsich, and Lutzen wherein the ever-renowned Prince Gustavus the Great lived and died a conquerour: with an elegie upon his untimely death, composed in heroick verse by John Russell, Master of Arts, of Magdalene Coll. in Cambridge.
titleStmt.author: Russell, John, d. 1688.
Russell, John, d. 1688. Elegie upon the death of the most illustrious and victorious Prince Gustavus Adolphus King of Swethland &c. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by [Thomas and John Buck] the printers to the Vniversitie of Cambridge. 1634. And are to be sold by Philip Scarlet,

notesStmt.note: "An elegie upon the immature and much lamented death of that most Christian souldier and renowned prince, Gustavus the Great", a reprint of Russell's "An elegie upon the death of the most illustrious and victorious Prince Gustavus Adolphus King of Swethland &c.", has separate dated title page; pagination and register are continuous.
A variant (STC 21460.3) lacks "And are to be sold by Philip Scarlet" in imprint.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

person.persName: John Buck] the printers to the Vniversitie of Cambridge. 1634. And
Gustaf King of Sweden, II Adolf,
